intro: Ctenium sechellense, commonly known as the Seychelles ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles archipelago. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within the region.
